p: The concomitant usage of Allium sativum and N. sativa seed in thirty postmenopausal women after two months of consumption revealed a significant reduction in plasma malondialdehyde (MDA) levels with increased activity in erythrocyte glutathione peroxidase (GSH-Px) and superoxide dismutase [ 38]. Likewise, the fixed and essential oil of black cumin seed revealed a significant increment of Glutathione-S-transferase (GST), glutathione reductase and GSH-Px against oxidative stress brought by potassium bromate in rats' model [ 39].
